dataPackages.name: camtrap-dp

tableSchemas.name: deployments
tableSchemas.title: Camera trap: deployments
tableSchemas.description: Camera trap: deployments schema

tableSchemas.name: media
tableSchemas.title: Camera trap: media
tableSchemas.description: Camera trap: media schema

tableSchemas.name: observations
tableSchemas.title: Camera trap: observations
tableSchemas.description: Camera trap: observations schema

allOf.description: Required schemas must be present: deployments, media, observations

dataPackages.title: Camera Trap Data Package (Camtrap DP)
dataPackages.description: Camera Trap Data Package is a community developed data exchange format for camera trap data.

dataPackages.name: coldp

tableSchemas.name: distribution
tableSchemas.title: COL Data Package (ColDP): distribution
tableSchemas.description: A structured distribution record for a taxon in a given area.

tableSchemas.name: media
tableSchemas.title: COL Data Package (ColDP): media
tableSchemas.description: Multimedia items for a taxon such as an image, audio or video.

tableSchemas.name: name-usage
tableSchemas.title: COL Data Package (ColDP): name-usage
tableSchemas.description: A simpler alternative to the 3 entities Name, Taxon and Synonym.

tableSchemas.name: name
tableSchemas.title: COL Data Package (ColDP): name
tableSchemas.description: COL Data Package (ColDP): name

tableSchemas.name: name-relation
tableSchemas.title: COL Data Package (ColDP): name-relation
tableSchemas.description: A directed nomenclatural name relation.

tableSchemas.name: reference
tableSchemas.title: COL Data Package (ColDP): reference
tableSchemas.description: Structured bibliographic references with a unique id to refer to from other entities. References can be given either as a simple, single citation string, or in a structured form.

tableSchemas.name: species-estimate
tableSchemas.title: COL Data Package (ColDP): species-estimate
tableSchemas.description: An estimation of the number of species for a given higher taxon, e.g. a family. The estimation must be based on a reference and should give the number of species according to a certain "type" that is expected to exist.

tableSchemas.name: species-interaction
tableSchemas.title: COL Data Package (ColDP): species-interaction
tableSchemas.description: A directed taxon relation representing species interactions. Different to a TaxonConceptRelation a species interaction can also point to a species (name) outside of the local dataset.

tableSchemas.name: synonym
tableSchemas.title: COL Data Package (ColDP): synonym
tableSchemas.description: A synonymous name for a taxon. Note that the same name can be linked to mulitple taxa by having several Synonym records to model pro parte synonyms.

tableSchemas.name: taxon-concept-relation
tableSchemas.title: COL Data Package (ColDP): taxon-concept-relation
tableSchemas.description: A directed taxon relation representing RCC5 taxon concept assertions.

tableSchemas.name: taxon
tableSchemas.title: COL Data Package (ColDP): taxon
tableSchemas.description: An accepted name with a taxonomic classification given either as a parent-child relation or as a flat, denormalized record.

tableSchemas.name: treatment
tableSchemas.title: COL Data Package (ColDP): treatment
tableSchemas.description: Treatments are parts of publications that "treat" a single taxon. They can be an original description for a new species, but also subsequent taxonomic works and usually include several sections such as a diagnosis, description, material examied, distribution, etc.

tableSchemas.name: type-material
tableSchemas.title: COL Data Package (ColDP): type-material
tableSchemas.description: Type material designated to names. Type material should only be associated with the original name, not with a recombination.

tableSchemas.name: vernacular-name
tableSchemas.title: COL Data Package (ColDP): vernacular-name
tableSchemas.description: A vernacular or common name for a taxon.

allOf.description: At least one required schema present: name, taxon, reference, name-usage
If 'name', 'taxon' or 'synonym' present, then 'name-usage' must not be present
If 'name-usage' present, then 'name', 'taxon' and 'synonym' must not be present

dataPackages.title: Catalogue of Life Data Package (ColDP)
dataPackages.description: The recommended exchange format for data to and from COL ChecklistBank is a tabular text format with a fixed set of files and columns.

dataPackages.name: material-dp

tableSchemas.name: material-entity
tableSchemas.title: MaterialEntity
tableSchemas.description: A material manifestation of an entity.

tableSchemas.name: gathering-event
tableSchemas.title: GatheringEvent
tableSchemas.description: A type of Event during which Material and/or Digital Entities are gathered. The eventType is implicit.

tableSchemas.name: identification
tableSchemas.title: Identification
tableSchemas.description: A taxonomic determination (e.g., the assignment to a taxon).

tableSchemas.name: agent
tableSchemas.title: Agent
tableSchemas.description: An agent is something that bears some form of responsibility for an activity taking place, for the existence of an entity, or for another agent's activity (https://www.w3.org/TR/prov-o/#Agent).

tableSchemas.name: digital-entity
tableSchemas.title: DigitalEntity
tableSchemas.description: A digital manifestation of an entity.

tableSchemas.name: agent-identifier
tableSchemas.title: AgentIdentifier
tableSchemas.description: An alternate identifier for an Agent

tableSchemas.name: material-entity-identifier
tableSchemas.title: MaterialEntityIdentifier
tableSchemas.description: An alternate identifier for a MaterialEntity.

tableSchemas.name: digital-entity-assertion
tableSchemas.title: DigitalEntityAssertion
tableSchemas.description: An observation, measurement, or other statement made by an Agent with respect to a DigitalEntity.

tableSchemas.name: material-entity-assertion
tableSchemas.title: MaterialEntityAssertion
tableSchemas.description: An observation, measurement, or other statement made by an Agent with respect to a MaterialEntity.

tableSchemas.name: gathering-event-assertion
tableSchemas.title: GatheringEventAssertion
tableSchemas.description: An observation, measurement, or other statement made by an Agent with respect to a GatheringEvent.

tableSchemas.name: material-entity-citation
tableSchemas.title: MaterialEntityCitation
tableSchemas.description: A record of citation against a material entity.

dataPackages.title: Darwin Core Material Data Package (Material DP)
dataPackages.description: A data package for Material focused datasets

dataPackages.name: interaction-dp

tableSchemas.name: organism-interaction
tableSchemas.title: OrganismInteraction
tableSchemas.description: An interaction between two Organisms.

tableSchemas.name: organism-interaction-assertion
tableSchemas.title: OrganismInteractionAssertion
tableSchemas.description: An observation, measurement, or other statement made by an Agent with respect to a specific instance of interaction between two Organisms.

tableSchemas.name: event
tableSchemas.title: Event
tableSchemas.description: An action that occurs at some location during some time.

tableSchemas.name: event-assertion
tableSchemas.title: EventAssertion
tableSchemas.description: An observation, measurement, or other statement made by an Agent with respect to an instance of Event.

tableSchemas.name: organism
tableSchemas.title: Organism
tableSchemas.description: A particular organism or defined group of organisms considered to be taxonomically homogeneous.

tableSchemas.name: organism-assertion
tableSchemas.title: OrganismAssertion
tableSchemas.description: An observation, measurement, or other statement made by an Agent with respect to an instance of Organism.

tableSchemas.name: material-entity
tableSchemas.title: MaterialEntity
tableSchemas.description: An entity that can be identified, exists for some period of time, and consists in whole or in part of physical matter while it exists.

tableSchemas.name: material-entity-assertion
tableSchemas.title: MaterialEntityAssertion
tableSchemas.description: An observation, measurement, or other statement made by an Agent with respect to an instance of MaterialEntity.

tableSchemas.name: digital-media
tableSchemas.title: DigitalMedia
tableSchemas.description: Media (sound, image, video, text) in a digital manifestation.

tableSchemas.name: digital-media-assertion
tableSchemas.title: DigitalMediaAssertion
tableSchemas.description: An observation, measurement, or other statement made by an Agent with respect to an instance of DigitalMedia.

dataPackages.title: Darwin Core Interaction Data Package (Interaction DP)
dataPackages.description: A data package for testing interaction data

dataPackages.name: extended-occurrence-dp

tableSchemas.name: event
tableSchemas.title: Event
tableSchemas.description: The spatiotemporal context (dwc:Event and dcterms:Location) of an activity.

tableSchemas.name: occurrence
tableSchemas.title: Occurrence
tableSchemas.description: Occurrences of dwc:Organisms in place and time.

tableSchemas.name: identification
tableSchemas.title: Identification
tableSchemas.description: Taxonomic determinations (e.g., assignments to dwc:Taxon).

tableSchemas.name: identification-taxon
tableSchemas.title: IdentificationTaxon
tableSchemas.description: The components and positions of dwc:scientificNames in a dwc:Identifications.

tableSchemas.name: material
tableSchemas.title: Material
tableSchemas.description: Entities that can be identified, exist for some period of time, and consist in whole or in part of physical matter while they exist.

tableSchemas.name: collection
tableSchemas.title: Collection
tableSchemas.description: Persistent formal repositories in which dwc:MaterialEntities and/or Media are preserved.

tableSchemas.name: genetic-sequence
tableSchemas.title: GeneticSequence
tableSchemas.description: Digital representations of a nucleotide sequences.

tableSchemas.name: chronometric-age
tableSchemas.title: ChronometricAge
tableSchemas.description: Approximations of temporal position (in the sense conveyed by https://www.w3.org/TR/owl-time/#time:TemporalPosition) that are supported by evidence.

tableSchemas.name: geological-context
tableSchemas.title: GeologicalContext
tableSchemas.description: Geological information, such as stratigraphy, that qualifies a region or place.

tableSchemas.name: organism-interaction
tableSchemas.title: OrganismInteraction
tableSchemas.description: Events in which interactions between dwc:Organisms were recorded.

tableSchemas.name: inventory
tableSchemas.title: Inventory
tableSchemas.description: Information associated with a dwc:Event that is an ecological Inventory.

tableSchemas.name: inventory-target
tableSchemas.title: InventoryTarget
tableSchemas.description: Specifications of characteristics of dwc:Organisms that were included or excluded in an Inventory.

tableSchemas.name: inventory-target-abundance
tableSchemas.title: InventoryTargetAbundance
tableSchemas.description: Reported quantities of observed dwc:Organisms of a given dwc:Taxon in a set of InventoryTargets.

tableSchemas.name: agent
tableSchemas.title: Agent
tableSchemas.description: People, groups, organizations and other entities that can act.

tableSchemas.name: agent-role
tableSchemas.title: AgentRole
tableSchemas.description: Roles filled by Agents with respect to other entities.

tableSchemas.name: assertion
tableSchemas.title: Assertion
tableSchemas.description: Assertions made by Agents about other entities.

tableSchemas.name: citation
tableSchemas.title: Citation
tableSchemas.description: Citations related directly to other entities.

tableSchemas.name: identifier
tableSchemas.title: Identifier
tableSchemas.description: Additional identifiers for entities.

tableSchemas.name: media
tableSchemas.title: Media
tableSchemas.description: Media (dcmi:Sounds, dcmi:StillImages, dcmi:MovingImages or dcmi:Text) about other entities.

tableSchemas.name: relationship
tableSchemas.title: Relationship
tableSchemas.description: Generic structure to specify relationships between entities.

dataPackages.title: Darwin Core Extended Occurrence Data Package
dataPackages.description: A data package for sharing extended Occurrence data.
